We all know about the rains which shower water .
But have you ever heard of the rain in which there is acid deposition in water ?
Of course it is a new phenomenon occurring since the past three decades in different parts of the world where industries are clustered and where large numbers of automobiles वाहनों .
Rain falls as pure water and on its enroute to the earth reacts with the oxides of sulphur and nitrogen to form acid .
No doubt from the industrial emissions where coal and oil are fired from factories and automobile emissions .
Acid rain is thus created by industrial activities that pollute the air .
The main sources are electric power plants that use coal to generate electricity .
Most coal contain small amounts of sulphur which is converted to sulphur dioxide when the coal is burnt .
Why are the environmental scientists so worried about acid rain ?
For it is a world - wide crisis because by गोलार्ध a large part of the northern hemisphere of the world it now रूख its attention to the industrial regions of the southern hemisphere which have borne out the waste of fresh water bodies and their products in the degradation .
अम्लता or पानी of water is measured on pH scale .
As already indicated rain - water has a pH of less than 7 .
What is then that makes the ordinary rain - water turn acidic - LRB - acid - RRB - and then the same applied to the soil as acid rain ?
The change is caused by the conversion of gases from industries ( oxides of sulphur ) and automobile emissions ( oxides of nitrogen ) .
These gases react under the influence of घुलने catalysts and sun ' s radiation before dissolving in water droplets and ice crystals .
These acid solutions fall to the earth as rain drops snow hail dew and dew .
A peculiarity of acid rain is that while the causative agents are emitted at one place the acid rain falls at another .
The pollutants released in one country enter the atmosphere and while circulating with the air currents move thousands of kilometres across the earth ' s surface to fall as acid rain .
For example the pollutants released in England and Germany were deposited as acid rain in Sweden and Norway .
While Canada releases much less of pollutant gases in comparison to the United States of America acid rain tends to occur mostly in Canada .
Rainfall knows no national boundaries and unlike other types of pollution acid rain is regarded as a global phenomenon .
Since the advent of the industrial revolution in the eighteenth century man has been engaged in discovering varied sources of energy for manufacturing varied types .

The new power plants were installed far away from the cities and high chimneys often more than 150 metres high to disperse the sulphur dioxide so that it would not reach the ground .
Most of the sulphur dioxide remains in the air for a long time so that more of it is converted to sulphuric acid .
A recent survey indicates that about 150 million tonnes of sulphur dioxide are discharged into the atmosphere every year which in turn is converted into sulphuric acid .
Two - thirds of these acid rains are due to sulphuric acid .
About one - third of the acid rain is due to nitric acid which acts in the atmosphere with oxides of nitrogen emitted by automobiles .
It is estimated that each year about 40 million tonnes of oxides of nitrogen are released into the atmosphere .

The Chief Justice dismissed the petition on 27th January 1930 and ordered the case to be conducted in the Meerut Sessions Court .
He said that a jury might not adopt a judicial view .
He further stated that he was not in favour of a jury trial since a jury would have to be taught and understood by the jury it would be a super - human task for any member of the jury .
Consequently the only judge could give a fair and just decision in a matter of this kind . "

Effects on Materials Air pollutants like sulphur dioxide smoke grit or dust etc.
Sulphur dioxide is the most damaging of all gaseous pollutants .
In the presence of moisture it gets converted into sulphuric acid which is very corrosive particularly for building structures because it reacts easily with lime .
Thus over the rainfed areas the stones gradually lose their colour .
Hydrogen sulphide is known to react with lead paint used in buildings causing formation of brown - black इमारतें .
वायु effects unlike other types of pollution can affect the climate.

Yes .
The pH is an index of hydrogen ion concentration of a liquid .
हाइड्रोजन low pH means high concentration of hydrogen ion and high acidity .
Pure water has a pH of 7 ( पानी ) which is neutral pH .
Water with pH less than 7 tends to become acidic and alkaline when above 7 .
Rain - water usually has a pH lower than 7 ( pH 5. 7 mild acid ) due to the dissolved carbon dioxide in it; this amount of acidity is not corrosive .
The pH range of acid rain - water is 2 - 5 .
This low pH means high acidity and subsequently high क्षयकारी .
Thus water with pH 4 is still more corrosive 10 times than water having a pH 5.
Water of pH 3 is still more corrosive 100 times than water having a pH 5.
If this is the case then one can imagine the corrosive nature of acid rain with a pH ranging between. 2 and 3 .
For instance relations between पश्चिमी West Germany and Sweden are sour because nearly 20 per cent of Sweden ' s lakes are affected by acid rains due to the emission of acidic gases from जर्मनी in Germany .

Nearly half of the sulphur deposits in Canada come from the USA and about 20 per cent of the deposits in North - East USA originate in Canada .
The direct relation of acid rain to human health has not yet been established .
However it is believed that inhalation of high levels of sulphur dioxide over long periods may lead to respiratory diseases like emphysema asthma and asthma.
India is not seriously threatened by this scourge as we have coal reserves with low sulphur content ranging from 0. 5 - 7 per cent .

Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi was born at Porbandar in Gujarat on 2nd October 1869 .
He was the youngest of three sons and had one sister .
His father Karamchand पिता was Prime Minister of Rajkot .
Gandhi was in school till 1887 .
Gandhi was married in 1881 to था .
After spending nine months in a college he left for England in September 1888 to study law .
He returned to India in 1891 and set up a practice .
In April 1893 Gandhi was called to Natal in the service of a merchant named Seth .
On arrival he experienced in person the harsh treatment meted out to coloured people by अश्वेत .
There he wrote ताल्सतोय : " The Kingdom of God was within you and he was much impressed by his writings .
Gandhi returned to India on 19 December 1914 and after an interrupted stay in February - March 1915 collected his companions of सत्याग्रह and established the Satyagraha Ashram in Ahmedabad city on 25 May 1915 .
It was shifted in June 1917 to the banks of the Sabarmati river opposite the city .
Between 1917 and 1918 Gandhi participated in two movements in Champaran ( Bihar ) and चंपारण ( Gujarat ) and in the labour dispute in Ahmedabad .
World War I ended on 11 November 1918 and this was followed by the proposal of the Rowlatt Bills designed to curb the rising tide of rebellion in India .
Gandhi reacted strongly against these repressive laws and led the resurgent Indian nationalism .
From 1924 to 1929 Gandhi devoted himself largely to constructive programmes and launched the " Satyagraha " movement .
In 1924 he was elected president of the Indian National Congress .
There have been a number of detailed studies on his life - history and political social customs religious and economic ideas .
Gandhi was looked upon by many primarily as a religious leader and many accepted him as the leader of Indian nationalism .
He was very regular and methodical in his habits and austere in his style of living .
Gandhi respected the sincere religious beliefs of every individual and his dealings with men and women were entirely humane and would be prepared to alleviate the sufferings of all the women who came to him for shelter .

The pH is an index of hydrogen ion concentration of a liquid .
Water with pH less than 7 tends to become acidic and alkaline when above 7 .
The pH range of acid rain - water is 2 - 5 .

Another important architectural feature is the torana द्वार which is essentially an arched festoon ( sometimes straight as in the toranas of Sanchi ) and marking a sacred or ceremonial doorway .
Such free - standing torana entrances or स्तंभ toranas are stated to have preceded the gopura entrances of ancient प्रासादों .
But while such स्मारकों torana has been retained in the northern monuments as at Sanchi and Bhubaneswar it is the gopura entrance that has prevailed in the south and forms the most characteristic and invariable part of the temple complex .
The torana idea is however not lost ; the motif is applied to many niches and entrances on the body of the vimana or the gopura and are known as भित्ति torana .

The जिला temple at जिला जिला is the largest and finest of the Ikkeri style of temples .
It is evident that this system of tiered arrangement of slopy roof slabs or कोर्निस curved one over the other was best suited to a region of high rainfall as was the original Kadamba region on the west coast .
It may be said that this form with either type of top member and devoid of or with the sukanasika is more or less a cross between the typical northern prasada superstructure and the southern विमान forms .
This type is evident from the मल्लिकार्जुन temple near the मल्लिकार्जुन temple at मल्लिकार्जुन the Mallikarjuna group on the way to the भूतनाथ group in the Badami valley and the महाकूटेश्वर temple which is all of the Badami - Chalukya - Rashtrakuta origin .
The group of smaller shrines behind the जिला temple at जिला ( Kurnool district ) and the पापनाशम group of temples in में are of this type in the Eastern Chalukyan region .
Eight of the nine structures of the Lakshmi Devi temple complex in जिला Hassan district Mysore 2 built in होयसल are of this type belonging to the Hoysala times .
In the Eastern Chalukyan area the जिले comprising the district of Kurnool प्रासाद and Guntur have such rekha - prasada - type temples built from the seventh - eighth centuries .
In the विमान complex of nine temples in विमान all except the विमान of the southern vimana type are of this type .
They mostly date earlier than AD हैं - LRB - AD के - RRB - when as stated in an inscription the prakara enclosing the whole group was built by प्राकार .
They are mostly nirandhara while a few are sandhara .
Each unit consists of a sanctum with a well - proportioned tri ratha sikhara है an antarala and pillared mandapa with a two - tiered flat roof .
The whole axial series has a single entrance in front and a continuous wall surrounding it forming also the outer wall of the sandhara type .
The exterior wall faces are richly carved with niches surmounted by मॉटिफ motifs containing fine sculptures and lattice images .
The carvings are fine and reminiscent of the central Indian and Rajasthani styles .
The most advanced and elaborate specimen of the group is the बालब्रह्म .
Most of these temples some with original foundations dating from the tenth - eleventh centuries have been considerably renovated and reconstructed in recent centuries and as a result do not show much that can be attributed to or interpreted as evolutionary trends .
What is generally not noticed is the internal build - up and structural contents of the srikoyil since by ritual tradition and convention the interior of the Kerala temple is totally inaccessible to any except the ordinated पुरोहितों .
What one perceives of the srikoyil is in fact an external shell as it were of a core vimana or भीतर inside .
The inner one which consists of the sanctum or shrine - cells is essentially a vimana form similar to that of the one on the other in the south having a बहुस्तरीय superstructure over its entire body with a higher . shrine on which the superstructure is raised .
The plan of this central unit generally does not correspond with the srikoyil base plan and its plinth and it is usual to find that the cella is square inside what is externally a circular or apsidal structure or vice - versa.
The ultimate outer conical ( बाहरी ) or छत roof covers the inner sikhara above the central structure with its stupi or it is placed over the griva making the stupi common to both .
While the sculpture is essentially of a central part or general vimana type the मानसूनी on the east of the Western Ghats rise in the body of the southern Ghats ; the outer shell of the srikoyil covers a much longer and constantly भीतर part of the west coast .

What is Unicode ?
Unicode provides a unique number for each character है
No matter what the ,
no matter what the program is.
be a language .
Computer keyboard shortcuts are basically dependent on those numbers .
They store letters and characters by assigning a number for each letter and character .
Before Unicode was invented there were hundreds of different encoding systems for assigning the numbers .
No single encoding may contain enough letters : for example the European Union alone requires several different encodings to cover all its languages .
For a language like English the same encoding was not enough for all the letters punctuation and technical symbols of common use .
These encoding systems also conflict with one another .
That is why two encodings can use the same number for two different characters - one or use different numbers for the same letter .
Any computer ( especially servers ) needs to support various signals e . g .
Unicode is changing all this .
Unicode (UTF - 32 provides a unique number for each character . No matter what the program है No matter what the language is .
The Unicode Standard has been adopted by a large number of industry players like सन सन सन Microsoft Oracle SAP सन सन सन सन and many others .
Unicode is required by modern standards ( अधिकारिक ) like जावा Java जावा ( Java script ) अधिकारिक ( जावा ) जावा ( C . पी ) and is applicable to जावा .
It is found in many operating systems - all modern browsers and many other products .
The emergence of the Unicode Standard and the availability of its supporting equipment are among the recent global software technology trends .
The induction of Unicode into client - server or multi - dimensional devices and websites offers tremendous saving in costs than using conventional devices .
Unicode enables a single software product or one website to find . that can be used in various देशों languages and countries without proper handling .
It allows data to be transported through different systems without hindrance .
Unicode (UTF - 32 is a non - profit organization founded to represent the presentation of text in the modern software products and standards बढावा to develop के extension and its use .
The membership of this organisation includes various corporations and organisations in the computer and information industry .
Membership in the Unicode Consortium is open to organizations and individuals anywhere in the world who support unicode and seek its extension and implementation .
